docs.title: SuiNS DAO Proposals and Voting Procedure
docs.description: The Sui Name Service DAO (SuiNS DAO) aims to provide a fair, transparent, and effective governance structure. The following process governs the rules and procedures by which members of the DAO may propose, vote and implement improvement proposals.  These proposals usually go through cycles of refinement and consensus, with the purpose of facilitating increasing community engagement in connection with each iteration. Thus, this process is designed to ensure that all decisions reflect the collective will of the community, maintain the integrity of the protocol, and foster sustainable development.

frontMatter.title: SuiNS DAO Proposals and Voting Procedure

docs.title: Sui Name Service Developer Documentation
docs.description: Integrate Sui Name Service (SuiNS) with your projects using either on-chain or off-chain resolutions, depending on your particular use case.

docs.title: Examples
docs.description: The following code sample is an initial example of how to integrate with SuiNS on chain. This page will host more examples in the future.

docs.title: Indexing
docs.description: The indexer enables more expressive queries about the active domain state, as the on-chain resolution wasn't enough to power the interface.

docs.title: Integration
docs.description: Integration with SuiNS works in multiple ways. For dApps, you typically integrate SuiNS through off-chain resolution using remote procedural calls (RPCs). The calls enable you to interact with the Sui network or display names instead of addresses. For example, your RPCs might create transactions that send assets to names, or show names instead of addresses on a leaderboard.

docs.title: SuiNS SDK
docs.description: Use the SuiNS SDK to interact with the Sui Name Service. Query SuiNS data in a usable way and build transactions that interact with service names.

docs.title: Querying
docs.description: Use the SuinsClient that was previously created to query on-chain data.

docs.title: Building Transactions
docs.description: SuinsTransaction is the client used similar to Transaction, and helps in building a transaction.

docs.title: Subnames
docs.description: Subnames are nested names under a parent name. Unlike regular names, there is not a cost associated with creating subnames.

docs.title: Sui Name Service Documentation
docs.description: Sui Name Service (SuiNS) documentation is divided into two main sections: User and Developer. The Developer section provides integration details for adding Sui Name Service (SuiNS) to your projects. The User section provides instructions on how to use the SuiNS portal to register names and integrate them with your web3 identity.

docs.title: Move Registry
docs.description: Move Registry (MVR, pronounced "mover") provides a uniform naming service for interacting and building with packages from the Sui ecosystem. This means that you can reference packages by their names, and MVR resolves the package address for you, despite the network.

docs.title: Design
docs.description: The Move Registry (MVR, pronounced "mover") consists of two independent components:

docs.title: Package Maintainer Best Practices
docs.description: For package authors and maintainers, the following best practices are recommended for working with the Move Registry. Following these tips ensures that other builders can use your package as intended.

docs.title: Managing Package Metadata
docs.description: The TypeScript examples assume that you use the MVR plugin for the Sui TypeScript SDK.

docs.title: Managing MVR Names
docs.description: The TypeScript examples assume that you use the MVR plugin for the Sui TypeScript SDK.

docs.description: Two main tools are available for use with the Move Registry (MVR):

docs.title: Transaction Plugin for Sui TypeScript SDK
docs.description: The Move Registry (MVR, pronounced "mover") Sui TypeScript SDK plugin offers builders a seamless experience when constructing programmable transaction blocks (PTBs) using MVR names.

frontMatter.title: Transaction Plugin for Sui TypeScript SDK

docs.title: Node Operators
docs.description: Full nodes for the Mainnet environment process SuiNS names without additional configuration. The Mysten Labs public nodes for Testnet also resolve SuiNS names.

docs.title: Sui Name Service User Documentation
docs.description: Build your on-chain identity in web3 with Sui Name Service (SuiNS). Using SuiNS, you can register a name (any name that isn't already registered) and use it for on-chain transactions.

docs.title: Update Avatars
docs.description: Have a special NFT that you want to represent your identity on chain? After you register a name, you can set the avatar to associate with that name.

docs.title: Linked Address
docs.description: You can change the address that your SuiNS name resolves to. The original address that registered the SuiNS name retains control over its configuration, but the name points to the address you provide.

docs.title: Register Names
docs.description: To enjoy the benefits of SuiNS, you must first register names. When you register available names, you purchase the rights to those names for one year. After registration, you can renew your names for multiple years.

docs.title: Renew Names
docs.description: You can renew, or extend the expiration date, for any of your registered names for up to five years.

docs.title: sui.id
docs.description: Using IPFS, you can create a sui.id address connected to your SuiNS name to claim a spot on the decentralized web. The IPFS protocol enables hosting peer-to-peer static sites or media that you can associate with your SuiNS name.
